poem:
"Elegy for the Tropicana"

Gold-dome's lights no more will blush,
Tropicana, Vegas's darling, now hush.
Chromium dreams of glamour, put away,
Where crime and celebrity once held sway.
Abrupt the departure, swift the fall,
Signalling the corrosive passage of all. 
Soon, explosive flourish, the final note,
As age yields to progress, we devoutly dote. 
An icon crumbles, beneath sky so vast,
From Bond to bust, nothing built will last.
